SENT.plain: We previously demonstrated the role of a phospholipid transfer protein (PLTP) gene variation (rs2294213) in determining levels of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) in hypoalphalipoproteinemia (HypoA)
We have now explored the role of PLTP in hyperalphalipoproteinemia (HyperA)
The human PLTP gene was screened for sequence anomalies by DNA melting in 107 subjects with HyperA
The association with plasma lipoprotein levels was evaluated
We detected 7 sequence variations: 1 previously reported variation (rs2294213) and 5 novel mutations including 1 missense mutation (L106F)
The PLTP activity was unchanged in the p.L106F mutation
The frequency of the rs2294213 minor allele was markedly increased in the HyperA group (7.0%) in comparison with a control group (4.3%) and the hypoalphalipoproteinemia group (2.2%)
Moreover, rs2294213 was strongly associated with HDL-C levels
Linear regression models predict that possession of the rs2294213 minor allele increases HDL-C independent of triglycerides
These findings extend the association of rs2294213 with HDL-C levels into the extremes of the HDL distribution
